alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 5:57PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly south of Benton along Highway 6. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - South of Benton along Highway 6 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of South Central Mono County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
